inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient has a history of recurrent UTI prior to her pregnancy.

inclusion.criterion: Severe active disease (≥1 attack every eight weeks or continuous symptoms).
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She has had at least two attacks of fever and chills in the past eight weeks.

inclusion.criterion: An attack will be defined as: Temperature of ≥38 ºC not otherwise explained.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At least two other accompanying symptoms (e.g. joint pain, lymphadenopathy, skin lesions, abdominal symptoms)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She also complains of dysuria, urgency and frequency, and has severe pain in the flank.

exclusion.criterion: Increased risk for infection or current infection
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a pregnant woman with symptoms of fever, chills, nausea and vomiting, dysuria, urgency and frequency, and severe flank pain.
